title: IC-er can add location to Activity

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
Currently the school-manager can not add or edit (or sometimes even: see) the location of an activity.

Allow them to add, edit, see and print the location of an activity.

title: Improve auto_placement algorithm

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
Related to #419

We want a (or multiple) auto_placement algorithms to place (or "finally enroll") students into activities.

There are several goals or concerns when "auto_placing": 
- optimize participation
- optimize development of Student (multiple talent_areas, multiple different activities)
- equal distribution: enroll students in popular activities only once.

We can have multiple algorithms and we can have school-managers choose between them.

For starters, we should develop a well working algorithm that, well, works.

We can even offer school-managers the choice which algorithm to choose per activity.

title: Student enrollment: avoid doubles

labels.name: Role: IC-er
labels.description: All functionality related to the schoolmanager

body:
if Student is enrolled for activity A on day 1 en time x: unenroll for activity B on same day and time.
Take into account the different Statuses there are for Participation status: 
        INTERESTED = 1, _('Ingeschreven')
        SCHOOLMANAGER_ENROLLED = 2, _('Voorlopig geplaatst')
        SCHOOLMANAGER_DENIED = 3, _('Voorlopig afgewezen')
        AI_ENROLLED = 4, _('Automatisch geplaatst')
        AI_DENIED = 5, _('Automatisch afgewezen')
        FINAL_ENROLLED = 6, _('Definitief geplaatst')
        FINAL_DENIED = 7, _('Definitief niet geplaatst')
        DROPPED_OUT = 8, _('Eerder gestopt')

We have an algorithm that is supposed to do this, but it works crappy, needs to be improved.

It is called auto_placement and can be found in schoolmanager/views.py

title: Check if there are multiple users with same email address
Create PWA/SPA for Parent role
body:
These are the current pages for the parent:
https://wijnandb.github.io/screenshots_automated/#/parent

We want the set_consent screen to be displayed immediately after login.
All screens have to be developed "mobile first".
We would like to create a optimal User experience. 

These are the things a Parent needs to do:
- see current schedule
- enroll child for new activities
- register absence for a child
- view information of a child
- edit information of a child
- see Portfolio 

Screens + information to be displayed on each screen: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hxANkJSeHLexSH_XNt5Yk8lKjyNhqTbQjMpSSzenimE/edit

We want to be able to send parents push-messages as well, for instance when placement for anctivity has been finalized, or if it's possible to enroll for a new activity.

title: Use black for automated code formatting.
Integrate tools like flake8 Python linting.
add field IBAN to Company
body:
To process invoices automatically, we need to have the IBAN for each company, to be added to the invoice.

In order to do that, we need to add an IBAN field to the Company model.

The structure of an IBAN is: CCxxBBBBxxxxxxxxx
x stands for a digit 0-9
CC for countrycode, like NL or BE 
BBBB stands for Bankcode, like RABO, ABNA, INGB, BUNQ, et ectera (all letters)

So for the Netherlands we are looking for a field of 18 characters and we could add a function to check if a valid IBAN has been filled out. 

Javascript check: https://github.com/arhs/iban.js

title: Error when creating new Activity
body:
When a user tries to create a new activity or edit an existing one on https://debredeschoolzuidoost.herokuapp.com/ppozo/activiteiten/
a 500 error is shown.
This doesn't happen on the local deploy or on the acceptance environment.

Apperently this happens when "DEBUG = False" is set.

I don't understand why this happens, do you @gurmessa ?

For now, the issue is resolved by doing just that, setting DEBUG = False in the production settings on Heroku

title: Horizontal scroll on Attendance page

milestone.title: Sprint 1
milestone.description: Testing how to work with milestones

body:
On the page where Attendance is filled out, we want to implement a horizontal scroll, so all dates are viewable, even on small screens. 

We also want to keep the first column fixed, so the name of the student is in view all the time. 

First get horizontal scrolling working, see [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66203217/horizontal-scroll-of-grid-with-items-width-equal-to-its-content](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/66203217/horizontal-scroll-of-grid-with-items-width-equal-to-its-content)

Then fixate the first column.

See also [Codepen](https://codepen.io/capnhairdo/pen/qBaGRBV)

title: Highlight navigation depending on section
CI/CD for Github and Heroku

labels.name: Operations
labels.description: Operations to be made for deployment

body:
How can we make sure that we only release code that has been tested?
How do we create a seamless CI/CD workflow?
We are using Github and Heroku, there are proven ways to do this.
Take a look at [these answers](https://chat.openai.com/c/e8639c22-62d6-47ea-aca3-1c43edb445cd)
- [X] Adopt a branching strategy like Gitflow or [GitHub flow](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/quickstart/github-flow).
- [x] Implement code review processes before merging PRs.
- [x] Ensure tests are written and categorized (unit, integration, end-to-end)
- [ ] #408
- [ ] Check code coverage with a tool like https://coverage.readthedocs.io/en/7.3.2/
- [ ] Configure GitHub Actions (or another CI tool) to run tests automatically upon every PR or push to specific branches.
- [ ] #400
- [ ] #401
- [ ] Security scanning with Bandit [read about Bandit and how to implement it](https://chat.openai.com/c/19d19557-5ef9-4365-8e1f-d7626d866ea6)
- [ ] Ensure the application builds correctly in the CI environment.
- [ ] Use Heroku GitHub integration for automated deployments upon code merges
- [ ] Deploy automatically to a staging environment after passing CI checks.
- [ ] Utilize Heroku Pipelines for a staged delivery process (Review -> Staging -> Production).
- [X] Manage environment variables securely using Heroku Config Vars.
- [ ] Handle database migrations and schema changes carefully to avoid downtime.
- [ ] Ensure you have a strategy for quickly rolling back faulty deployments.
- [x] #378

title: Interface improvements
body:
The website has quite a lot of terrible pages. Bad performance, bad UI, bad UX.
One way of fixing that is by using JavaScript or REACT to create some better UI/UX.
We are setting up a project where we are going over the different roles that visitors can have (parent, teacher, company, school_manager, super_manager) and go over the different tasks they have to (be able to) perform.

Based on that, we decide how we will put together the UI for each role. We might even decide to create a different PWA for the parents, taking into account that most are using mobile devices to interact with the website.

We have started monitoring website traffic, so we know how people are interacting with our website.

@gurmessa 
- [ ] What would we need to create a PWA for teachers?
- [ ] Can we use Push and Notifications? For instance,
- [ ] send a notification to parents when they can enroll their children, 
- [ ] send a notification when  their children are finally enrolled
- [ ] when their child has an activity that day

title: Performance issues

labels.name: Operations
labels.description: Operations to be made for deployment

body:
Some pages are really slow. In order to remedy that, let's do three things:
- [ ] Check which pages are slow
- [ ] Check why they are slow
- [ ] Fix issues so they aren't slow anymore

title: Reminder mail to teachers
body:
We want to send reminders to teachers prior to the start of a Schedule, to ask them to fill out Attendance records. Let's discuss the best approach for this, we could check every hour, check once per day, we can send separate mails for each Schedule or group them per teacher.

If Attendance hasn't been filled out after 6 days, we send a reminder to the Company, so they can remind their teacher(s).

In order to test this, create a mail that says:
"Hallo,
Denk je er aan om de aanwezigheid in te voeren voor de activiteit {{ schedule.activity }} op {{ schedule.day }} om {{ schedule.time }}.
< link to attendance for this schedule >

Met vriendelijke groet,
Het team van de Brede School"

@gurmessa replied: we can use celery library to create scheduled task that a runs at a specific time . we get start time & date of a schedule, we then deduct 30 minutes ,schedule a celery task

also here we can create a scheduled a task at schedule datetime plus six days

title: veld status - gearchiveerd werkt (nog )niet
body:
[![Screenshot_2022-04-13_14-06-32.png](https://mrkr.io/s/6256d8e8455d7d0da2d20ddf/2)](https://mrkr.io/s/6256d8e8455d7d0da2d20ddf/0) Hallo Wijnand, Is het mogelijk om de status gearchiveerd werkend te maken? Dan kunnen we voorlopig alle overeenkomsten van 2021 daarop zetten en staan ze niet meer in het IC account. In juni moet er een mogelijkheid komen om de 2 periodes jan-apr 22 en sep- dec 21 los van elkaar te archiveren. En mei-juli 22 komt dan in afgelopen. Kan deze verandering van status ook geautomatiseerd worden? --- **Reported by:** Trudie (tbijlsma@ppozo.nl) - [Contact via Marker.io](https://app.marker.io/i/6256d8e8455d7d0da2d20de0_3d640c425b6fa40c?comments=1) **Source URL:** [https://www.bredeschoolzuidoost.nl/ppozo/overeenkomst/338/edit/](https://www.bredeschoolzuidoost.nl/ppozo/overeenkomst/338/edit/) **Issue details:** [Open in Marker.io](https://app.marker.io/i/6256d8e8455d7d0da2d20de0_3d640c425b6fa40c)
